sen.j: 御間城姫（みまきひめ、生没年不詳）は崇神天皇の皇后。
sen.e: Mimakihime (date of birth and death unknown) was the empress of Emperor Sujin.
Mimakihime (date of birth and death unknown) was the empress of Emperor Sujin.
Mimakihime (date of birth and death unknown) was the empress of Emperor Sujin.

sen.j: 古事記には御真津比売（みまつひめ）とある。
sen.e: Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) describes her as Mimatsuhime.
Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) describes her as Mimatsuhime.
Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) describes her as Mimatsuhime.
Her father was Obiko no Mikoto.
Her father was Obiko no Mikoto.
Her father was Obiko no Mikoto.

sen.j: 名前からして、任那出身の女性と考えられる。
sen.e: From her name, she was thought to have come from Mimana.
From her name, she was thought to have come from Mimana.
From her name, she was thought to have come from Mimana.

sen.j: また、古事記の崇神天皇の条には、崇神が大彦の叔父と読める部分があることから、夫・崇神天皇と従兄妹関係だった可能性があるが不明。
sen.e: Also, since there are sections in the articles on Emperor Sujin in Kojiki which Emperor Sujin may be interpreted as an uncle of Obiko, she may have been cousins with her husband, Emperor Sujin, but it is not clear.

Also, since there are sections in the articles on Emperor Sujin in Kojiki which Emperor Sujin may be interpreted as an uncle of Obiko, she may have been cousins with her husband, Emperor Sujin, but it is not clear.
